result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Alan Hanson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:51 AM Defendant Mark Alan Hanson in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Mark Alan Hanson.  Attorney Robert Barrington in court for State of Wisconsin. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; status conference set; bail con't
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Alan Hanson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Mark Alan Hanson (not determined); Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $10,000 Cash bail; Atty. Strohschein response; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 7/14/22 at 8:30am in Br. 2 & Review 7/13/22 at 8:15 am in Br. 2; Court sets $10,000 CASH Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
